Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Epileptic Encephalopathy, Early Infantile, 64 present clinical features that include seizures, cognitive impairment, and behavioral problems. The disease is caused by mutations in the gene KCNQ2, which encodes the voltage-gated potassium channel Kv7.2. The channel is expressed in the brain, heart, and skeletal muscle.
